subject: RE: [junit] multiple assertions
msgSnippet: We thought about this approach at first, but the scope of these tests and the sheer number of attributes to be asserted made for a pretty big test suite. ...
messageBody:
We thought about this approach at first, but the scope of these tests and the sheer number of attributes to be asserted made for a pretty big test suite.

-----Original Message-----
From: Chris Eppstein [mailto:ceppstein@...]
Sent: Friday, February 22, 2002 3:58 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] multiple assertions


A very simple approach to this is to use multiple test methods (one for each
assertion that requires a result). Common code can be extracted to a
separate method so it is easier to maintain.

Is this approach infeasible for you?

-----Original Message-----
From: Hoepner, Josh (J.M.) [mailto:jhoepner@...]
Sent: Friday, February 22, 2002 10:13 AM
To: Junit (E-mail)
Subject: [junit] multiple assertions


Hello all,

I am fairly new to JUnit and I have come across a problem while writing test
cases. I am in a situation where I require one test case to have multiple
assertions. If one of these assertions fails, I still need the others to
run. I'm sure someone else has tried something like this in the past, does
anyone have any suggestions?

Thanks,

Josh Hoepner
Great Lakes Technologies Group
